title: Every Place I've Ever Lived
name: Every Place I've Ever Lived
description:
A Map by Jbo

I move a lot.  That is ironic since I'd rather be dragged across carpet tacks and dipped in rubbing alcohol than move.  Here's every place I've ever lived.

properties.name: 01. First Place I Ever Lived
properties.description: Posted by Jbomadison heights, miAug 1974 - Dec 1978. I know it was on Alger and 12 Mile. Lived there from birth to age four. My mom would know the exact address. We moved because it was getting ghetto. It supposed to have gotten better again.

properties.name: 02. 19376 Lloyd, Clinton Twp., MI
properties.description: Posted by Jbo19376 lloyd, clinton twp, miDec 1978 - Dec 1992. Orange County? Scottsdale? Hoffman Estates? No, but it might as well have been. This is the random, mindless suburb I grew up in. Where I lived from age four to eighteen. We left right after I graduated High School. All hail Best Buy.

properties.name: 03. Brooks Dr., Oxford, MI
properties.description: Posted by Jbo brooks dr, oxford, miThis little bit of hell is where I lived with my parents during the summer while I was in college. Thankfully they wised up and moved back to civilization shortly after graduation.

properties.name: 04. 004 Larzelere Hall
properties.description: Posted by Jbomt. pleasant, miLived here freshman year with Ryan, Ramez and Ken the pig. And I mean pig in every possible meaning of the word.

properties.name: 05. Ghetto Apartment on Deming, Mt. Pleasant, MI
properties.description: Posted by JboMt. Pleasant, MILived here Junior year with Frank (who has disappeared from the planet. Frank? Where are you?! People are looking for you!), some skank whore white trash named Danielle, and her sister who was mostly harmless. All in all it sucked. But thats what you get for 00/month in a college town apartment run by townie hicks that have nothing but contempt for the students that put food on their tables. Probably because most townies (save the professors) didn\'t even graduate High School.

properties.name: 06. West Campus Apartments.  West Campus Dr., Mt. Pleasant, MI
properties.description: Posted by Jbo Mt. Pleasant, MILived here first senior year with Ryan and Heather! Best year of college. It says Vernon, but the map is labeled wrong, its West Campus Drive.

properties.name: 07. Apartment on Walnut, Mt. Pleasant, MI
properties.description: Posted by JboMt. Pleasant, MIPlace I lived with Randy my second senior year (actually it was just a semester, and I only had three classes). I wasn\'t there much, I went home every weekend to work. I remember it reeked of mildew.

properties.name: 08. Someplace off N. Saginaw Rd near Eastman, Midland, MI
properties.description: Posted by JboMidland, MILived here for four months right out of college while I worked at The Dow Chemical Company. Four months of Midland was all I could handle and I got a transfer to Detroit. I guess being the height of the tech-boom they would let punk kids right out of college get away with requesting a transfer after four months on the job.

properties.name: 09. 822 E. Fifth, Royal Oak, MI
properties.description: Posted by Jbo822 East Fifth St., Royal Oak, MILived in this cool old-but-restored apartment in Royal Oak with Ryan for a couple of years while I worked for Dow and Accenture. I can still remember when Ryan decided Fifth should go all the way through the park, so he cut through the park with no headlights at 2am. I\'m still amazed we didn\'t kill a hobo.

properties.name: 10. Oakwood Apartments on Via Marina, Marina del Rey, CA
properties.description: Posted by JboMarina del Rey, CALived in this corporate apartment for two months when I got a job in LA.

properties.name: 11. 7358 Woodrow Wilson Dr., Los Angeles, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jbo 7358 Woodrow Wilson, Los Angeles, CALived here with Stephanie and her cousin Barrett (who came out of the closet and turned into an instant asshole). I actually only lived here for seven months but this is where I met Matt and Martha and Anne and Kevin, so it was all good.

properties.name: 12. Bluffside Dr., Studio City, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jbo Bluffside Dr., Studio City, CALived here for about five months with this guy Bret (yes, one T) in a semi-interesting apartment that supposedly Heavy D lived in. No, I don\'t find that interesting either. Five months was long enough to know that human beings were not meant to live in the valley, or have roommates named Bret with one T.

properties.name: 13. 365 S. Cloverdale, Los Angeles, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jbo365 S. Cloverdale, Los Angeles, CAA very cool apartment in the Miracle Mile part of LA. I Only lived here a year because the parking situation was unbearable. Too bad too because I loved the apartment. Looking at the satellite image you can see the lighter patch of roof closer to the marker. That is where they had to replace the roof because in the El Nino rains my ceiling was literally raining from about 50 different spots. I was on the roof at 3am in my underwear sweeping water off the roof while I waited for maintenance to show up.

properties.name: 14. 1627 Hillhurst, Los Angeles, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jbo1627 Hillhurst, Los Angeles, CAAug 2001 - Dec 2003. Possibly the best apartment in Los Angeles. Dax and I (and later Jorge) lived in this huge vintage Hollywood apartment that had been totally restored for about 500/month. It was easily worth more than twice that much. We had a view of the Hollywood sign and the Observatory (which is now blocked by a monstrosity they built next door that doesnt show up in the satellite image). Matt and Martha moved in the the exact same unit across the courtyard, only they had a different owner that didn\'t restore theirs so we called it bizarro world.

properties.name: 15. 1333 Argonne Ave., Long Beach, CA
properties.description: Posted by Jbo  1333 Argonne Ave., Long Beach, CADec 2003 - Jan 2006. The first house Jorge and I bought together. We restored most of it over the two years we lived there. I really miss it, but on the other hand we were drowning in debt so it was good to get out and make an enormous profit. Woe be upon those with adjustable rate mortgages...

properties.name: 16. 853 Commodore Dr., San Bruno, Ca
properties.description: Posted by Jbo 853 Commodore Dr., San Bruno, CaMay 2005 - Jan 2006. A very crappy temporary apartment I lived in for the first year I worked in Silicon Valley and we were trying to decide whether or not to sell the house. I commuted to LA every weekend.

properties.name: 17. Folsom & Precita, San Francisco, CA
properties.description: Posted by JboFolsom & Precita, San Francisco, CAJan 2006 - Present. A nice brand new apartment in San Francisco. Grossly overpriced but I get a subsidy from work so who cares. Can\'t imagine buying in SF, very, very overvalued real estate.
